content: simply bulky cowl by shannon larson justlivin designs email justlivindesigns@gmail com instagram @justlivindesigns simply bulky cowl materials pattern with us #10/6mm needles cast-on 72 sts yarn 100g/106 yds bulky weight yarn place bor marker and join to work in the * sample uses 1 skein polka dot sheep big sky round * i used the cable cast-on but use bulky in tally lake us #10/6mm 24 circular needle or size whichever co you would like just make it loose needed to obtain gauge work k2p2 rib for 1 i did 4 rnds darning needle stitch marker then knit straight st st for about 8 or 9 from co edge * if going by weight knit until gauge you have the right amount of grams remaining that you will need for the ribbing and bobble 13 sts and 17 rnds = 4 /10 cm in pattern in the round on pattern needles work k2p2 rib for 1 i did 4 rnds sizes bobble in pattern loosely weave in ends and block one size finished measurements 22 circumference and 10 tall abbreviations k-knit p-purl st-stitch st st-stockinette stitch round-round pm-place marker bor-beginning of round co-cast on notes this cowl is knit in the round beginning and ending with rib it is meant to be a quick and easy gift knit and my gift to you is to make it a free pattern this is a great pattern for men women and kids hint if you would like to get the most out of your ball of yarn weigh it before you begin in grams and make a note then once you co and do ribbing weigh the ball of yarn again subtract this number from the initial weight you will want to have at least that much yarn left to finish the cowl with ribbing and bobble © justlivin designs 2021 2
